qas.question: Which era included a rapid growth period?
The Phanerozoic era covers what time period?
In which era, did the first phylum of multicellular organisms appear?
What type of diversity showed an overall exponential trend?
In which event did the rainforests collapsed in the carboniferous?
Which era included a rapid phylum period?
The Cambrian era covers what time period?
In which era, did the first phylum of organisms appear?
What type of diversity showed an overall extinction trend?
In which event did the vertebrates collapse in the carboniferous?

context: The history of biodiversity during the Phanerozoic (<a1_0><b6_0>the last 540 million years<b6_0/><a1_0/>), starts with rapid growth during <a0_0><a2_0><b5_0><b7_0>the Cambrian explosion<b7_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>—a period during which nearly every phylum of multicellular organisms first appeared. Over the next 400 million years or so, invertebrate diversity showed little overall trend, and <a3_0><b8_0>vertebrate<b8_0/> diversity<a3_0/> shows an overall exponential trend. This dramatic rise in diversity was marked by periodic, massive losses of diversity classified as mass extinction events. A significant loss occurred when rainforests collapsed in the carboniferous. The worst was <a4_0><b9_0>the Permian-Triassic extinction event<b9_0/><a4_0/>, 251 million years ago. Vertebrates took 30 million years to recover from this event.
